page.title: 19LIFE STYLE
page.content: A study was done of a family who had built a house and lived in it for 50 years. Before this the family had lived in the area and been bakers since 1870. The owner of the house was a carpenter in St Albans who also did painting, engraving and enamel work in a studio in the garden. During the war they bred rabbits to provide the family with food. The house was connected to the electricity supply in 1939. Until 1939 they had a chemical closet but then built a cess tank, they were connected to the mains water and sewerage system in 1953. Today they keep pet geese, ducks and rabbits.
